description: The Emeritus Faculty Association (EFA) has been providing a student scholarship through our Association. Each year the scholarship recipient is rotated among the five colleges. The recipient (either undergraduate or graduate student) shall be selected by the designated college and enrolled full-time. The recipient will be awarded the scholarship at the EFA Spring Luncheon in April. Eligibility Sophomore, Junior, Senior, or Graduate Student Cumulative GPA of 3.0 Must be enrolled full-time (12 hours for undergraduate students and 9 hours for graduate students) Must demonstrate financial need Requirements Personal statement describing an activity student is engaged in either on or off campus and why it is important to the student and their future Official transcript

general_criteria.description: Soft requirements that provide additional points/consideration

hard_criteria.description: Hard requirements that must be met to qualify for the scholarship
